Description: Lip and wall sherd of East Greek black-figured pottery bowl; pale orange clay with white inclusions and much silver mica; glaze fired shades of orange-brown; interior: glazed with faded palmette and tongues above red band lined in white; exterior: cream slip; hindquarters of a bull to left; filling ornament: blobs; broad band painted below main decorative field; incision used for details of bull.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1024)
